Definition: All literature with original data: peer reviewed papers, but also pre-prints (this implies unique data that is not otherwise already included in the analysis)
is about the perceived accuracy of fake AND true news
measures accuracy or an equivalent construct (e.g. trustworthiness, truthfulness)
provides all relevant summary statistics (i.e. accuracy ratings for both fake AND true news) or data to produce them; a mere discernment score is not enough
provides a clear control condition that is comparable with those of other studies
